metadata.description: Specifies the name of the Web App.
Specifies the name of the hosting plan.
Describes plan's pricing tier and instance size. Check details at https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/pricing/details/app-service/
Describes plan's instance count
Specifies the name of the Application Insights used by the Web App.
Specifies the network access type for accessing Application Insights ingestion. Possible values: Enabled or Disabled.
Specifies the network access type for accessing Application Insights query. Possible values: Enabled or Disabled.
Indicates the flow of the Application Insights ingestion. Possible values: LogAnalytics, ApplicationInsights, or ApplicationInsightsWithDiagnosticSettings.
Specifies the name of the storage account used to store the boot diagnostics logs of the virtual machine.
Specifies the default action of allow or deny when no other rules match for the storage account.
Allow or disallow public access to all blobs or containers in the  storage account. The default interpretation is true for this property.
Allows https traffic only to storage service if sets to true. The default value is true since API version 2019-04-01.
Specifies the name of the virtual machine.
Specifies the size of the virtual machine.
Specifies the image publisher of the disk image used to create the virtual machine.
Specifies the offer of the platform image or marketplace image used to create the virtual machine.
Specifies the Ubuntu version for the VM. This will pick a fully patched image of this given Ubuntu version.
Specifies the name of the administrator account of the virtual machine.
Specifies the SSH Key or password for the virtual machine. SSH key is recommended.
Specifies the storage account type for OS and data disk.
Specifies the number of data disks of the virtual machine.
Specifies the size in GB of the OS disk of the VM.
Specifies the size in GB of the OS disk of the virtual machine.
Specifies the caching requirements for the data disks.
Specifies the location for all the resources.
Specifies the name of the virtual network hosting the virtual machine.
Specifies the address prefix of the virtual network hosting the Web App and other resources.
Specifies the name of the subnet hosting the Web App.
Specifies the name of the subnet hosting private endpoints.
Specifies the name of the subnet hosting virtual machines.
Specifies the name of the subnet hosting Azure Bastion.
Specifies the address prefix of the subnet hosting the Web App.
Specifies the address prefix of the subnet hosting private endpoints.
Specifies the address prefix of the subnet hosting virtual machines.
Specifies the address prefix of the subnet hosting Azure Bastion.
Specifies the name of the private endpoint to the storage account used for boot diagnostic logs of the virtual machine.
Specifies the name of the private endpoint to Azure SQL Database.
Specifies the name of the private endpoint to Azure SQL Database.
Specifies the name of the Azure Bastion resource.
Specifies the globally unique name of the Log Analytics workspace.
Specifies the SKU of the Log Analytics workspace.
The pricing tier of the new Azure Redis Cache.
Specifies the pricing tier of the new Azure Redis Cache.
Specifies the family for the sku.
Specifies the size of the new Azure Redis Cache instance.
Specify a boolean value that indicates whether to allow access via non-SSL ports.
Specify a boolean value that indicates whether to allow access via non-SSL ports.
Specifies the name of the new Azure SQL Database server.
Specifies the name of the new database to create.
Specifies whether or not this database is zone redundant, which means the replicas of this database will be spread across multiple availability zones.
Specifies the admin user of the SQL Server
Specifies the password of the admin user of the SQL Server
Specifies the version of the SQL Server
Enable or disable Transparent Data Encryption (TDE) for the database.
Specifies the database collation for governing the proper use of characters.
Specifies the type of database to create.
Specifies the capacity of the SQL Server database.
Specify a boolean value that indicates whether to allow access via non-SSL ports.
Specifies the maximum size, in bytes, for the database
Specifies the minimum capacity.  Autoscale engine will ensure the instance count is at least this value.
Specifies the maximum capacity.  Autoscale engine will ensure the instance count is not greater than this value.
Specifies the default capacity.  Autoscale engine will preventively set the instance count to be this value if it can not find any metric data.
Specifies the metric name.
Specifies the metric upper threshold.  If the metric value is above this threshold then autoscale engine will initiate scale out action.
Specifies the metric lower threshold.  If the metric value is below this threshold then autoscale engine will initiate scale in action.
Specifies the percentage to increase the instance count when autoscale engine is initiating scale out action.
Specifies the percentage to decrease the instance count when autoscale engine is initiating scale in action.
Specifies whether the autoscale policy is enabled or disabled.
Specifies the retention policy.
Specifies the name of the key vault.
Specifies whether Azure Virtual Machines are permitted to retrieve certificates stored as secrets from the key vault.
Specifies whether Azure Disk Encryption is permitted to retrieve secrets from the vault and unwrap keys.
Specifies whether Azure Resource Manager is permitted to retrieve secrets from the key vault.

Specifies whether the 'soft delete' functionality is enabled for this key vault. If it's not set to any value(true or false) when creating new key vault, it will be set to true by default. Once set to true, it cannot be reverted to false.
Specifies the softDelete data retention days. It accepts >=7 and <=90.

Controls how data actions are authorized. When true, the key vault will use Role Based Access Control (RBAC) for authorization of data actions, and the access policies specified in vault properties will be ignored (warning: this is a preview feature). When false, the key vault will use the access policies specified in vault properties, and any policy stored on Azure Resource Manager will be ignored. If null or not specified, the vault is created with the default value of false. Note that management actions are always authorized with RBAC.
Specifies the Azure Active Directory tenant ID that should be used for authenticating requests to the key vault. Get it by using Get-AzSubscription cmdlet.

Specifies the permissions to keys in the vault. Valid values are: all, encrypt, decrypt, wrapKey, unwrapKey, sign, verify, get, list, create, update, import, delete, backup, restore, recover, and purge.
Specifies the permissions to secrets in the vault. Valid values are: all, get, list, set, delete, backup, restore, recover, and purge.

Specifies the permissions to certificates in the vault. Valid values are: all, get, list, set, delete, managecontacts, getissuers, listissuers, setissuers, deleteissuers, manageissuers, backup, and recover.
Specifies whether the key vault is a standard vault or a premium vault.
Specifies the name of the private link to key vault.
Specifies the name of the secret that contains the SQL Server connection string.
Specifies the name of the secret that contains the Azure Cache for Redis connection string.
Specifies the name of the secret that contains the Application Insights connection string.
Specify a boolean value that indicates whether to allow access via non-SSL ports.

properties.value: [concat('Data Source=tcp:', reference(variables('sqlServerId')).fullyQualifiedDomainName, ',1433;Initial Catalog=', parameters('sqlServerDatabaseName'), ';User Id=', parameters('sqlServerAdministratorName'), '@', parameters('sqlServerName'), ';Password=', parameters('sqlServerAdministratorPassword'), ';')]
